title: Bunch of gothics - motor nameplates
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015063420im_/http:/typophile.com/files/513-MotorGeneratorNamePlate-_4746.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015063420im_/http:/typophile.com/files/volvo_6043.jpg)

Asking for my friend, I will start with Futura in first Volvo picture. Rest? :D.  
She is particulary interested in those numbers.

Thanks
author: sandrosandro

comments.content: For SECONDARY END, I would say some version of Akzidenz Grotesk (one that has that type of R leg, like [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/ag-book-std/med-ext/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015063420/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/ag-book-std/med-ext/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/ag-book-std/med-ext/"))
the upper right goteborg-sweden (below volvo logo) appear to be a variant of futura condensed, and the text above it at the left margin is futura book. old helvetica appears to be used as well
The bottom left one could be [Nobel Condensed Bold](http://web.archive.org/), presuming this weight existed.
